place_description: More than 30 arcade games headline this modern spot serving craft beers, cocktails & sodas.

reviews_data.review_text: Didn't get any food but the cranberry and gin was great and reasonably priced.  The arcade itself was crazy fun, refreshing nostalgia.

What a great pinball hall. Ive heard about it from friends but never stopped by because its about 40mins from home but is it worth it! Plenty of tables of all styles and designs. Games for all ages also. Plenty of games from when i was younger. It has a nice outdoor area and a good sized bar. I spent a good amount of time here today and i could see myself coming back. Its a bar also, so its 21+ after 6pm to my understanding.
A nostalgic revival of the 90s arcade with courteous staff, a welcoming vibe, and games you can only find here. Highly recommended!
Insanely fun bar arcade! They have a lot of variety and a bunch of pinball and rhythm games now

One of the best arcades I've ever been to! I came mainly for the pinball and the machines were all in fantastic condition. I encountered very few notable issues while playing. I'll definitely be returning if I'm in the area again.
It's so cool. And I feel like a pin ball wizard with a side of Initial D.
Cool atmosphere and employees, decent prices, always a good time.
This is the best arcade.
This spot is so dope. It reminds me of Blimpies in Brooklyn! I enjoyed
super fun. cheap drinks, good vibes.

Didn't have anything from the bar and they don't serve food but a clearly very popular food truck was right outside their doors! Very fun atmosphere and reasonably priced! The big Lebowski pin ball machine was my favorite!
Yall lit lmao
Amazing, well-maintained arcade. They will literally fix a broken cabinet within a couple hours if you report it
Good place to just hangout.

When you are in Charlotte and love arcades you have to stop here. It's a bar for +21 and up M-F. But on Saturday and Sundays kids can come in and play games from 12-6pm. My kids loved it! We played games from Japan and pinball games I've never seen before. After the kids played the arcade games they sat on the couch and played a round of PS4. This spot has nostalgia all over it with retro tv shows and cartoons playing in the background.
Cool Arcade ! The vintage style and smell
The arcade was amazing 10/10 recommend the reason why it's only four stars is because one game had broken but overall very good place for family!
I have been to a lot of arcades. This is the best one I have ever been to, by far.

For the pinball player, the games new and old are all in excellent condition. Video game WACCA is a blast!
Bartender/technician Cory is a great guy all the way around.

Can't believe I had never been here before. This place is really cool even if you are not much of a gamer, it has a lot if nostalgia from games in the past. Lot's of games to choose from, kid friendly with adults (cause it is a bar too) I think during the daytime only. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. Plenty of parking and across the street parking. Sometimes food trucks are there, but a couple of restaurants are within walking distance.

My wife and I were here for a popup market.  We were surprised how big this place is.  I have not played centipede in many decades. I will soon. Very nice bar with a good selection of beers. Staff is friendly. If in the Belmont neighborhood this place is worth a visit. I was told to go check out the back patio. I will after this review.
An amazing and exciting place ! Such a great place to have fun and relax
this place is so much fun; we went for the retro game swap event in May and spent a few hours in the arcade after and everyone was so nice
Parking is a nightmare. Otherwise it's perfect
Small but great place to have some drinks and play some classic video games
I can play Wacca here. Therefor, 5 stars.

Super Abari Game Bar is a gem for arcade enthusiasts! The wide selection of pinball machines and arcade games guarantees hours of fun. Their daily drink specials are a bonus, and the outside patio adds to the vibrant atmosphere. Great spot to hang out with friends and unleash your inner child!
Plenty of pinball and old style machines. Got lots of tokens for our money
This place took me straight back to my childhood love it. They got the Simpsons arcade game man. Classics. Definitely making this the late night chill spot

One of my favorite places to check out in Charlotte. Great drink options at the bar and so many amazing pinball and arcade games. And seriously, who doesn't light up seeing a 6ft tall Game Boy that you can play Tetris on?!
I always enjoy going here with my Fiance when he visits. Super fun!!
Was amazed walking in ANY old game its DEF HERE
They got $2.50 PBR and several choices of arcade games. Bang for your buck.

This is a GREAT arcade. They use tokens, only 2 tokens (0.50) per game. Lots of fun imported games, plus rarer pinball machines including Labyrinth, The Big Lebowski and Pulp Fiction. Plus a GIANT Game Boy that is a MUST see! Only drawback: Limited parking. Be prepared to walk a block or so if you get there during busy times.

WOW! i felt like I was back at the bowling alley arcade in 1995! A true blast from the past feel! This was an awesome experience with so many of my favorite pin ball and arcade games! I wanted to take the simpsons home with me lol mortal kombat was just as remembered it! Duck hunt REALLY brought back memories!

Definitely love going to this place since Abari game bar closed down. This is a cute little spot to hang with friends or go on a first date. Didn't give 5 stars because the place is a little small so the game options are limited and there are a lot more pinball machines than necessary. But overall decent game selection, good priced drinks and fun retro games.
I love this place, it's so much fun and they have a great selection of games and all of them are extremely reasonable pricing. You can have a great time with a group of friends just with 10$

We went for a Maker's Market and LOVED it! It was a Sunday, I brought my nieces & nephew (15 & 9),  and they've already asked to go back. They have a great selection of pinball and other games, plus some gaming consoles set up at TVs to use. They use tokens, most games take 2, and I only spent $20 on the 4 of us and we had a great time.

The bartenders were super nice and helpful, and they give free refills on kids soda. They drinks were really nice- homemade syrups and such- and relatively inexpensive.

Can't wait to come back without the kids!

What a fun place. A true pinball lover's dream...open late. Not for families though.

All pinball games are .50. $10 will give you great value. All my favorite games growing up, and in excellent condition. Set to non-expert playing parameters, too.

Very clean throughout and friendly team. Beer selection seemed quite diverse (although I wasn't drinking). I'll definitely be back on my next trip to Charlotte.

Beware of dirt parking lot across road when raining.

Had such a great time here! This was my first time coming to the newer location, and I must say that I definitely enjoyed this location better than the last location they were previously. This space is much bigger and more organized, I feel. It didn't feel so cramped. As soon as you walk in, you are greeted with a bar and then a couch where you can play games on PS4 or Xbox. We played a few rounds of Mario Kart and loved it! There are some stairs that lead you down to the arcade. You have to purchase tokens to be able to play the games. The games only require either 1 or 2 tokens each, so you will definitely get your money's worth. They even have a few games that are "free play," which basically means it's free, and you just hop on and start playing. Came on a Saturday night around 8 pm, and it was not busy yet. They have parking around the building, but if it gets full, they do have free parking across the street on an empty lot. They did have a taco truck right outside, and you could order food and bring it inside and eat. They do have 2 tables you can sit at and enjoy your drinks and food. Overall, it was a great experience and will return. It is a great place to bring kids during the weekend from 12-6pm.
Loved this place. Good diversity of games from pin ball to xbox. Even had some Japanese rhythm games which were a blast to play. Highly recommend. Didn't try the food but there's a foodtruck outside.
Never had the food but the atmosphere is great, and there's so many pinball machines!

Best pinball bar in Charlotte! Pinball is only 50 cents which is great, and you can use card or cash to buy tokens to play. The drink menu is very fun & the bartender is good. The ambiance of the place is great.
Best arcade in town!

Such an AWESOME place. Takes you back to the past. Great games. Great decor. So many fantastic pinball games. Old classics and new ones. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Highly recommend. On a scale of 1 to 10 this place is a definite 11. Thanks

Best Barcade I've ever been to!
And the second best retro arcade I've been to ever outside of Funspot in NH and the value to coins/cash is really fantastic. Great local business to support!

Wonderful arcade bar! They give great value on the games. I spent $20 in tokens and could literally have played all night if I wanted to. Parking is also much better than the old location. Finally, the machines were all in excellent shape. You can tell that the owner and staff are proud to work here. Can't wait to go back!
Fun times!
I had a good experience. Drinks (lemonade, since I don't drink alcohol) were fine - free refills. Games were great too.

Wow what a great place. For a kid who grew up
In the 80's this place brought back so many great memories.
Friendly staff made us feel welcome. Lots of fun.
A great date night idea for anyone who enjoys gaming. Parking however is horrible.  There are pot holes galore & very little lighting
I thoroughly enjoyed myself! The atmosphere was definitely adult friendly. Also my children had a great time on Sunday during children hour.

Wow, this place is a must see.  If you want to go back to some old school video arcade this is the best place to go.  All the games were in excellent condition. My 2 adult sons and I got $40.  Worth of tokens and spent the next 3 hours playing.  This place even had a bar!!! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!
Unique excellent execution Viva la Good Times!
Awesome place to go! All the machines are in great condition, like a time machine. They serve alcohol and soft drinks. Spent 10 dollars in tokens stayed over an hour. .50 to play most games!
This is a great arcade bar. Drink prices trend on the high side but the games are super cheap and well maintained. Top 3 Arcade bars I have ever visited.
Great selection of games

Had a lot of fun here. The praises are probably what you'd expect for a game bar. The only thing I'd change is I'd take out some of the pinball machines for more racing sim games or at least additional cockpits for the one they do have,  motorcycle racing would be great too.
Didn't try the food though.

This is such a cool bar. You walk in and you can be playing Super Marios on the couch. Drinks are available for purchase. There was a food truck outside as well. The food from the food truck was okay. However, I love all the games they have. Everyone is friendly. The pinball machines were lots of fun. And the OG games like Mrs. Pacman are free. We had such a great time. Highly recommend everyone try for a date night. Parking is across the street. Games are cheap. You get tokens. Games are 50 cents.....Today...this is unheard of. Try it out!!!

One of a kind amusement center! Appx. 30 vintage pinball machines and 30 arcade style games. Mix drink bar with a food catering truck frequenting. It was very crowded on New Years, but manageable. Everyone seemed to take it in stride. Staff was very responsive to any and all issues from spilled drink to a game not working correctly.  They fix their own on the spot. Definitely need to visit this one!
The only food I saw was in a vending machine. The bartender was nice. I really like the set up. The area is clean and well lit. There is a great selection of pinball machines and video games.
A dream come true!

Came here on a trip to Charlotte. Its a nice barcade. They had a decent beer and cocktail selection that was affordable. I loved how the classic games were free to play. Every newer game was about a token to play. There's a token machine that accepts card and cash.
I love this place, if you like arcade games and chill vibes, this is the place to be!
neat spot to grab a drink and hang out with friends

If you are into pinball you don't want to miss this spot. It is exactly what you want to find when going to a pinball bar. All of the pinball games I played were in working order. They had lots of classics and new games too. The selection of local beers made up for the lackluster cocktails.

Great place for any occasion, especially date night. Many retro arcades and pinball games and lots of drink choices. When it comes to food, they invite local food trucks and are within ordering distance of delivery apps. Whether you live in Charlotte or just passing through, I highly recommend stopping for a drink and some retro gaming at Abari!
A watering hole for all the millennials in the city who grew up gaming. Definitely my go to place if I'm out alone. You always meet dope new people here!
This place is so much fun. Really brings me back to being a kid!
My family took me here for my 70th. So much fun for all ages!
The greatest place on earth.

The absolute best place! Love the people and the environment. A great and safe place to have cocktails or mocktails and enjoy time and games with your friends!

Highly recommend!
Nice play some of the pinball machines need work very sluggish and hard to play. Drinks for not very good.

Fun place to play some games and have some drinks.
I give their drink specials, drinks, and drink prices a 5/5! Great deals and delicious mixed drinks and can't pass up on PBRs haha
I give their games 3/5. Some games were broken and some games would eat your money.
Millennial heaven for nostalgic games! Great beer selection and really nice bar considering the arcade vibe.

Great pinball! Could be better lighting on a number of machines, since some were too dark to see. No gender-neutral bathrooms, which makes it not the safest space for non-binary people. (Apparently you have to ask staff to use a special restroom ) Otherwise, the vibe is great! 50C/ pinball! Halloween was well-lit and my favorite play of the night
This is a quality arcade bar. I had a lot of fun here and would recommend coming here if visiting Charlotte.

Drinks were good, games were great fun, awesome atmosphere, and the bartenders were outstanding. We had a blast and will definitely be back for more fun again.

Several free classic games, tons of pinball games, American and Foreign games for a great variety.

Fun drinks
Fun games
Fun times!

Incredible atmosphere, great drinks (the slushies are especially good) and loads of fun games, both very old and very new. Perfect place to go with friends, not too expensive and, amazingly, not too loud either! The smoke machine is a perfect touch too.
A variety of games and I love the staff
Pinball and crazy arcade games
Affordable drinks, great atmosphere, friendly staff

Really cool spot with very nice staff. Drinks were great, they have a small snack menu also. My only real complaints are the parking is a little brutal, not really something they can necessarily fix. The other thing is, we came to play on the Blast / Astro Cities (not on free play mind you) and the side by side 2up with Super Turbo in it had a bad 2 player (right) stick and buttons. Keep those things in shape because retro players notice these things.

Edit: see response below. Now I know and knowing is half the battle!
Super fun and chill place to go! Everyone was so kind and I plan on going here again

This is a great bar where you can enjoy playing video games from the 90's with a beer and some delicious food. I love the atmosphere, the staff is really nice and the mixed drinks are delicious! I also love my cheap PBR  I'll keep coming back, this is a cool place for us millennials to hang out

First visit and were immediately greeted by a women who explained how everything worked (super helpful).  Games were .25 to .50 and all were in working order, lots of great pinball machines.  I don't think there was a single game out of order, they clearly stay on top of maintenance.  Bartender was friendly.  Definitely will be back!
I've only been here twice, but this is a gamers bar for sure if you ever want to feel nostalgic. This is the place. The drinks are also good

The atmosphere is always relaxed here. There are a ton of pinball machines and the prices are very reasonable. The bartenders are friendly and quick. There is a side patio toward the back left of the building with views of the city, too.
The best gaming bar in town! Cool layout and even cooler arcade games! They've got Super Smash Bros

GREAT ARCADE TO GO TO THE STAFF IS AWESOME TO ALL THAT SHOW UP

ALSO 3S THURSDAYS IS FIRE
This is the place to play pinball and arcade games, with a drink, in Charlotte.
Very fun and unique spot!
100% worth a visit between events, the arcade machines and pinball, and wonderful people constantly coming in!
They have MICHAEL JACKSON MOONWALKER..... AUTOMtic 5 stars. I've been looking for this game for years and almost cried when I saw it.
Cool spot. Most of the games are pinball so be prepared for that! Great spot for a date night or a smaller group of friends. There was a Vietnamese food truck when I went. Loved their Thai tea

Love this place! I didn't try any of the drinks but others in my group did and liked them.

I was pleasantly surprised with the arcade game selection. I felt timewarped back to my arcades in the 80s/90s and DBZ was playing on their projection screen.

Managed to take the #1 spot on Street Fighter 3rd strike before leaving.  Will be back for sure!!
So nostalgic! Reasonably priced and good vibes all around.
The rhythm game selection is a godsend. Genuinely love coming here just to play Taiko.

This is probably as close as you'll find to an "old arcade" feel from the 80s/90s. The bar and seating area is up top as you walk in and then you go down a short few steps into the arcade area.

They have a mix of newer (mostly foreign...Korean/Japanese I believe) and older games, with a lot of pinball tables. Almost all games are 1 or 2 quarters (pinball is 2). A few of the older games are on free play (Burgertime for example). Took over an hour for me to go through $10.

Plenty of parking on Saturday afternoon in the lot directly across the street. Place was busy at 2 but not "crowded". On Saturday afternoon there was a large mix of parents waiting upstairs while their kids played downstairs, dads playing with their kids, 20s on their own, and 40s reliving their memories.
Fantastic experience! Will definitely be a new regular here
It's a beercade. They're all pretty much the same. I do enjoy the ones that offer free games more than paying but I'm cheap
Am absolute must! Amazing pinball, the best shooters, and perfect retros. The giant game boy is so cool. And a mind blowing pokemon station that could last for hours. This is a small slice of heaven
Awesome place always a good time to play some retro and some interesting arcade games

90 percent of this place I love!!! Very laid back, smoking area outside, games are classic, strong drinks, photo worthy everywhere. The only issue I have is that there are plenty of moments where I was double charged and had to wait days for the charges to fall off.
Fun place to have a beverage and play old school video and pin ball games. I especially like the crab volleyball and arm wrestling games. Fun stuff.

Love it here!  The team is super friendly. The games are well kept.  If there's a problem, there is someone there to fix it, or they reimburse your tokens.  I won't go to any other barcade in Charlotte. Super Abari for life!
A pretty busy arcade and bar. Well maintained equipment.  Parking is limited.
Absolutely my favorite place to visit every time I am in Charlotte. Get my pinball fix.
A great place to go for drinks and games!
Initial D and the selection of rhythm games are a lot of fun

Cool place for your nostalgia. About 15 parking spots. A large area inside filled with a few gaming consoles,  about 30 pinball machines.  And another 30 arcade stations.  Games are token based so games start at 25 cents and go up to 75. We played enough games between the two of us for 10 bucks.  There was no entrance fee or membership. Had a small bar for alcohol or underage drinks. Bathrooms were clean.  Recommended for kids, date, or groups.
Definitely my favorite place to hangout in Charlotte. Zach and all the bartenders are the best, and the events they hold there absolutely rule.

Definitely one of the top Charlotte barcades! It is almost as much fun + cool as the Emporium in Chicago! The prices for games are good. I also like that there are events for a few days. There are a variety of game types available. I enjoy that there are locally developed game cabinets as well.
This place is awesome! Great games, people, smoking area and PBR tall boys! They had one of my favorite fighting games from my teenage years, Time Killers!! A rare find!
Super cool place with reasonably priced beer
Go here if you have to wait for a table at The Pit. They have a great pinball selection and Dance Dance Revolution!
I live here. 11/10
So many pinball and arcade games! Good drinks too! Recommend!
Great staff.. fantastic new location.... great value.....

Pretty chill place that I'd only heard of. Went there on a Saturday night, pretty busy evening. Arcade games brought back a lot of my childhood memories. Bartenders were on point when it came to getting drinks. One of the faster services, in a bar that I'd ever experienced.

Came by with a group of friends and had a great time. I'm not really a gamer but I found myself playing a few and having a great time. It is very loud and cold, so definitely can be overstimulating- but do not fret, step outside to their patio for some serenity. The staff was super nice as well. I'll probably be back.
Cool staff and LARGE variety of some of the best classics. Overall retro atmosphere.

I visited Super Abari Game Bar about a month ago. I will definitely be back.

Great selection of classic console and arcade games.

All arcade surfaces were clean. I don't drink alcohol and I feel that their non alcoholic beverages were priced moderately.

They also had a little lounge area where you could sit with friends or chat with them at the bar stools. Very cool setup.

They also have pinball machines.

The free parking lot is pretty big as well.

So glad I stopped!! Extremely nice host and bartender and very reasonable prices for games and drinks. They even have free play! Such a unique blend of game choices from pinball to shooting games that are not even in American. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! great for kid dates regular dates and everything in between !
Some of the best maintained machines ice seen at a bar.  Go here!

Really cool place with lots of pinball and unique arcade machines. I'm pretty sure you need to be 21+ to enter. They have a token machine so, I recommend brining a couple of 5 dollar bills is you want to maximize your experience.
The best barcade in Charlotte. I heard a  remy main likes to play third strike here and I also heard he is very handsome and charming. I do wish I was as cool as someone who mains remy and not ken.
This is such a fun experience. Retro video games definitely make you feel all the nostalgia! The drinks are delicious!
Great spot!  Fell in love as soon as I walked in and saw Robotron 2084.  Will be going back as soon as I can.

Been wanting to play initial d stage 8 Infinity for awhile now and I literally had a blast playing this game. The staff at super abari are super friendly and helpful.this place is a must visit if your in Charlotte
Fantastic place to go and just hangout with some friends good games and good drinks!

They have great atmosphere and the employees are super friendly. Parking can be a bit of a hassle but they have loads of pinball machines, retro game arcade cabinets (super street fighter 2 etc), and a game corner where you can play n64 games and Xbox. I went on a Thursday and they had specials on drinks I barely spent anything and I was there having fun for hours. I definitely recommend a visit at the minimum.
We had so much fun!  Some games are .50, some are .25 and some are FREE! Their craft beers are awesome, and my husband and I are looking forward to going back real soon!
So much fun if you like pinball and old cabinet games. We really enjoyed this place for a fun date night activity.
1st time at the new location still the same great atmosphere. If you are into classic arcades and drinks, this is the place for you. Enjoy.
Fantastic fun.
Favorite gaming bar!! So many games to choose from! The people are really friendly and it's a great place for a good time.
Great collection of retro arcade machines

Super Amazing Game Bar is more like it, all the games that weren't free only cost 1-2 tokens (Averaged about .50), excellent staff, great themed and regular drinks, very clean and a great environment for people 21+! I loved my time and can't wait to go back!
This place is rad. They have the best assortment of pinball and classic arcades in the area. Cool and knowledgeable bartenders that are truly gamers. Highly recommend!
Games. Drinks. Great spot to hang with friends. What else could you want

The new building is awesome! The layout is really functional with the bar right when you walk in and then the whole arcade down the lit up steps. So much more space to play and watch others play! The bouncer and bartenders are really great too! It's always a blast getting to spend an evening there.
Best place in Charlotte to hang out!

Probably my favorite bar/arcade or arcade/bar in Charlotte. They have a great selection of retro, and a few newer, arcade machines as well as pinball.

They no longer require a "membership" in order to get in. Additionally, they can put a charge on your tab in case you're like me and just don't carry cash for change machines anymore. Just ask the bartender for $5 in tokens.

The biggest perk is that during the weekend says kids are welcome! However, once 5 PM hits they need to find a new place to hang out as it becomes adult time.

A great place to stop on your way home from work or just to wait for some traffic to clear.

good selection of games, great drink prices, staff is friendly and fun, and the atmosphere is a perfect mix of chill and nostalgia. the only reason it's four stars and not five is that every game costs quarters (except N64 on the TV at the front). other barcades in Charlotte have free games.

updated to 5, they got Mario Kart!!!

We had a blast celebrating my daughter's birthday at Super Abari! Terence, the Asst. General Manager, promptly to emails when I had questions or concerns. On party day, he was patient and helped us with on-site requests.

There are tons of classic games and several newer ones. There is something for everyone here.

We brought our own food, and drinks were available at the bar. Terence suggested Shirley Temples instead of Sprite, and they were a hit!

The tables reserved for our party were spacious and comfortable. The restrooms were small but very clean.

Our party guests had a great time, and we're all looking forward to returning soon.
Your all in one place... drinks, video games, arcade machines, and pinball machines
If you were born in the 70s then this is YOUR spot! Frickin amazing!
Pinball/Galaga/Centipede...

Dropped in because we found it on the Mill District map.  Good beer, friendly staff, big selection of games especially pinball.
We've been to "barcades " in Raleigh, Portland, rock Hill, this is the cleanest we have ever experienced.  We will be back with friends.
I love this place. I've been coming since they were still abari game bar. Great games, great prices for drinks.
Best arcade in NC
Not a lot of games but loads of pinballs if that's what you are looking for. I thought it would be a mix of pinballs and arcade games but it was a one time good visit.
Good drinks good fun!
Cool place tons of games
Love this place, amazing staff, game selections, value, and drinks. Even the sign to the bathroom was awesome.
A lot of fun with good prices.
First time at the new place and wow! So much different. Really enjoyed it.

Wonderful arcade bar. I've visited numerous arcades in Las Vegas, Asheville, Chicago and Atlanta, this place is top notch. Lots of classic arcade, shooting, and music games. 37 pinball machines in good condition including Indiana Jones, Halloween, Willy Wonka, Creature from the Black Lagoon and Stranger Things. While I was there (on a Saturday night) not a single pinball machine was out of service. The place is open till 2am like a true bar, and offers liquor in addition to beer and nonalcoholic beverages. Reasonable drink prices, particularly for canned drinks. Super Abari is almost exclusively 21+ with the exception of noon to 5pm on Saturday and Sunday. They have a nice fenced-in patio outside for smoking and taking a break outdoors. No cover fee, just coin op, 50 Cents a game. No real food but a nice vending machine inside for a mild snack. Friendly and courteous staff. Customers there seem relaxed, chill and respectful. This place is hosting the 2023 NC State Pinball Championship and it shows. If you're interested in an arcade bar or just a bar to play games at, this place is gold. Highly recommend.
Pinball for days! Great new building and location

This place is ok, they have good games for .50 cents. Girl bartender just seemed like she didn't want to be there. Drinks are cheap. Hardly any parking but there some across the street which is less than a min walk.
Fun place,good pin ball games

We had a wonderful experience!
If you like arcade games, then you'll
love this place.  The staff are nice n friendly. Some games are free!
We would definitely recommend this barcade for first timer's!!!

Came here with my 66 year old dad (I am 34), I had my I.D. but he did not. I tried to order a drink and they told us that he couldn't even come in and play without his I.D. We left immediately, didn't even try to argue with the stupidity.
Glad to have Abari back. A few machines are a bit broken which is unfortunate, but there's still plenty to enjoy.
Not too busy on a Thursday night.  Kind staff and lots of classic games to choose from. Nice sense of community amongst other gamers.  $0.50 per play on pinball and even some free play games.
Nice bard and atmosphere mixed crowd food truck retro gaming
It was a great atmosphere if you like video games as it's a chilled spot but good people

Absolutely the best Bar for us GROWN kids to play!!! The amount of games was in of itself wildly pleasing. The atmosphere along with great bartenders and the cocktails inspired by or paying homage to retro games is enough to always have me ready and thrilled to get back.  Definitely if you're into having a good arcade experience with some delicious house special cocktails like the "princess peach" , or you wanna vibe with the energy & excitement from Nintendo64 Mario kart while you kick back on the loveseat next to the couch of lucky players lol. Then this is the spot man. Follow them on IG

Super Abari is a very fun bar with a good selection of retro arcade games. There's mostly pinball machines but plenty of other games to try out also. Large bar at the front of the building with a good selection of beer/liquor & service has always been quick and friendly. They have an outdoor space which while nothing special is good to take a break in between games. I would recommend this bar to anyone who is looking to go to a game bar, it's the best one I've been to in Charlotte.

Best barcade in charlotte, dosent try to be a party bar like other barcades in charlotte, ya know, sticking to what you are, and drinks are cheaper than the other barcades around. Staff is always polite, and the games are great!
This is the best place to go on a date, the games are a good distraction so you don't get anxiety  drinks are good and atmosphere service is as well!
Games and liquor? And it stays open till 2am? You got me.
Loved this place , great selection of games and impressive collection of pinball machines, was definitely impressed
Cool place! Downside is there isnt many free arcade games, all take coins but seem cheap. The drinks aren't very cheap either, but thats expected for Charlotte.

Awesome place! Great pinball selection and the games are all extremely well maintained.  Also tons of retro arcade games and a staff that clearly cares about their customers.  Stop by, you won't regret it.
Cheap beer and you can put quarters on your tab to keep playing all night. I take my kids in the day and Abari has step stools for them to use.
Really fun concept. My friend and I had a great time here. Drinks and games. Would be cool if you could win prizes like the arcades back in the day.
40 and older crowd only :(
Still a great fun place to come play some games, and hang out. Taiko Taiko Drum is amazing
Abari is my happy place!  Great collection of pins and an atmosphere that can't be beat!
Love the old school arcade games
I love this place.
So many fun games and decent prices for drinks!
Super fun atmosphere, nice patio are, great bar staff.

Great place with plenty of pinball machines to play, all in great condition. Good beer, but didn't have any cash, so had to 'buy' tokens with my credit card. Was surprised that a 5$ cup of tokens cost 5.50$!! OK, but it would have been nice to have known they charged for the service in advance!

Omg I discovered this place months ago and I fell in love.  To start it's a bar with old arcade games that I played growing up. Some of my favorite games that you can play there are: Galaga, Frogger. Pacman, Ninja Turtles, Donkey Kong, Mortal Combat and a large amount of pinball machines.  The drinks I didn't care for much even though they had cool names. They're not worth $15 each for a small plastic cup. I don't think they have food so if they don't they should definitely have some munchies. Parking can be tight even with the additional parking across the street.
Go to Optimist Hall for dinner and then hit Abari for a nice date night ;)
Great place to drink and game!
Awesome place
Oh, my god...this place is rad. Good drinks and games. They have this weird warhead seltzer...love it
I went here in 2016 when I came down for a class. It wasn't upgraded yet, but I still had a lot of fun with my comrades.  Took me back to my childhood. Very nice.
I absolutely love the selection of pinball games great place to grab a drink and play some pinball and other old school arcade games as well
So much fun and the drinks are fantastic. Got a lil tipsy and made friends with the employees, I'm a social butterfly. They are super nice and cool to chat with.
It took me awhile to get to this location but worth the wait. Very well laid out arcade bar. The staff was friendly and the drink prices were reasonable. Large variety of games.
Very nice atmosphere for gamers. Lots of retro games and pinball.
I couldn't get in
Who doesn't love a good game bar?! This is probably now my favorite game bar! Had a lot of games I have never seen before. Definitely a fun spot and it has some fun multi player games!
Always have fun here

Fun and very unique (for CLT, anyway) place for adults and kids alike, even if it seems like a secret supper club based on the strange website and complete inability to contact them by phone. Huge selection of old school video games and the biggest selection of pinball I have ever seen. Be careful because you can burn through a lot of cash very quickly.

I went with my two kiddos, ages 9 and 2.5. The 9 year old loved it. The place was definitely not geared for toddlers, but we made do (he enjoyed putting the quarters into the slots more the than games themselves).

Note to parents: I *think* kids are only allowed between 12-5pm on weekends, although I'm not sure. That's why I was trying to call them to verify, but...secret society (see above).
Love the vibe here! Bar and arcade, who can go wrong??
Incredible spot on a night out in the city! I recommend taking a group of friends here and playing the multiplayer arcade games!
The hot pockets have been revamped and they are SO GOOD! Love the new cocktail menu as well
It was cool. This was my first visit to the new location. I got the same cool vibe as the old one. The games brought back memories but please try to get Arch Rivals!
games were nice not 5he drinking type atmosphere tho.
Great selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. Family time on weekends is a lot of fun. Highly recommend this place if you are a fan of arcades or a nice atmosphere to hang out.
Drinks are a little pricey but it's a great environment. Would recommend getting food before going here.
Great experience, will definitely go again
Amazing game selection and good atmosphere.

Went to the original Abari Game Bar when my girlfriend and I first moved down here a couple of months before the pandemic and thought it was pretty cool. Super Abari is even better thanks to the larger space that they have. Not only that, they such a great collection of old school arcade cabinets and pinball machines that are all well maintained. You also have a giant Game Boy as soon as you walk in and is completely playable. I'd say the only downside if there is one is that there's no food on the premises. I don't know if it's because we're in NC, but so far every barcade I've visited after moving to the area does not offer food. Other than that, I'd highly recommend it and if you're a fan of fighting games you'll most likely find me there trying to rack up the wins with one quarter

This place is a lot of fun, especially for those that enjoy arcade games. Unfortunately, the parking lot is commonly full and it can be challenging to get in as a result. The good news is that while you may wait for parking, you rarely need to wait for the arcade games to be available as there are plenty for visitors to enjoy.
Fun place with old school arcade games and pinball machines good prices. Bar has a good selection of beer and a few on tap also the slushy was great!

This place is so cool! Lots of old time pin ball machines and button-mashing video games, a long with a few modern ones. All games are anywhere from 25-50 cents per play, and you can buy quarters with a card if you don't bring cash. I'm not a gamer but I had a great time with friends here! Only reason I gave 4 stars is because their liquor drinks are expensive, $16 for a double  compared to the beers that were $2.50, but I would go again!
Time Crisis and a few other games I peeped, but it was so many pinball machines omg! Pretty fun overall.

Was a fan of the last spot and this one doesn't disappoint.

All kinds of retro games, new games and great drinks. Crowd has always been super awesome, highly recommend.
Felt like a little kid again
If you are considering going, go! They have the best selection of pinball machines in Charlotte. EVERY machine is either a classic or a new Stern favorite.
Amazing place.  Great atmosphere.  Very laid back, nostalgic, and clean environment.  Great place for a night out with friends.
Definitely a good selection of games to choose from, also laid out nicely. Prices are pretty reasonable as well. Will be back
Great business and leadership

Definitely a cool spot to play fun games and vibe with friends. I like that they have an elevator to the gaming floor . The steps are pretty festive with lights. They had gaming groups and some folks rocking alone. Saw all sorts of games. My fav is the oversized Gameboy upstairs... but what took my heart was the Alf stuffed animal in the machine. Took me back! The outside patio was nice and the string lights make it fun.

Sadly- I came out there bc my sister was being followed by another guest she didn't know. I didn't want her to feel unsafe. When I arrived I found her on the patio still being harassed.  I then intervened by asking him to step away and not come near us. He then took convo up with other guests in the corner. We left soon after. She expressed she would not be returning after finding out he frequents the space due to his "living" situation. She is an avid gamer and was looking forward to supporting the gaming crew she is apart of and the relocation to this new amazing space- but she doesn't want to be targeted either. I encouraged her to speak up and tell management if it occurred again. Unfortunately I didn't see any security if there was any present.

This is actually a new location after the original Abari location closed. ( Naming the place Super abari is the best thing ever). As a result a lot of old reviews incorrectly got ported over. I once said Paranoia Pinball was the only correct spot in Charlotte to play pinball (and is still my preference), but this place is now up there as well. Walking down the stairs and seeing the old tvs playing 80s scenes and hearing and seeing all the games was definitely a portal into the past. There was parking at the building and overflow parking across the street, as Saturday evening was ramping up people were playing Tetris to park. The crowd felt more "Instagram" than "Basement dweller" but that might change as the newness of the place wears off. Plenty of .50 cent pinball. They actually had a pinball tournament going on. The grand champion scores on machines attest that the machines have been played by serious players. Bar served drinks and food, not too impressed with the draft beer selection or the size of the bar, but it was tolerable. Overall it was a good experience and I'm happy to see more pinball in Charlotte.

Edit: Another thing I forgot to mention is that this place is open all the time, even on most holidays it seems, up until 2 am! It's nice to finally have a retrocade that is open on the "slower" days, when everywhere else is closed. I stayed until close on Sunday and I noticed the staff were taking the time to clean the pinball glass, which was a nice attention to detail. Staff have always been very friendly.
Very cool, price per game (especially the pinball) is ridiculously low.  They just need to expand their beer selection.
Great bar with tons of arcade cabinets and pinball machines! Drinks were definitely affordable, only gripe was how tight everything can be on a crowded night but it's not too bad.
Very cool place with a ton of pinball tables and games to choose from!
Great place to chill out and play a great selection of pinball games!

Not sure how it is in the evening or late night but early afternoon on a Saturday saw a decent crowd, families with kids even. Had plenty of space while I occupied one of the SF3 Cabinets...definitely glad to see this place reopened. Absolutely the best in class. Looking forward to an Initial D Cab and hopefully maybe even establish some Tournaments !!

Was pretty cool earlier in the evening. Lots of games for great prices and a good selection of drinks. Later in evening it got really crowded and with all the games being so close together, it was hard to play certain games without being elbow to elbow with someone. Docking some stars because 1) they charge you extra $$ for getting quarters from the bar (at least let customers know about the $2 fee when they order), and 2) they don't allow you to pay your tab with any leftover quarters you have.
1200th Review! What do I win?

Abari game bar is back as Super Abari. By my eye they may have more than tripled their space and increased game options by a large amount. I for one am glad this type of venue came back in my area because it's my my type of arcade rather than the college frenetic scene of say...Slingshot. Thanks for being back!
This spot is awesome
Pinball Arcade!!!!
This is the place. Good beer, good beats, good vibes.

Had a great time at Super Abari. I wish they would switch to a cover price system rather than having to get physical change to put in the arcade games. Charge $15 per person at the door and get unlimited gameplay. I've been to similar bars that do that.
Killer time, awesome games, nice staff, clean bathrooms,

That glow up though. The new spot reveals a very club/cruiseship like essence where you're  greeted with the doorman and bar and then opens up to the game floor. Their selection of old school vs. new school games is unparalleled. Parking is pretty easy with lots next door and a lot across the street. Stop in and lose yourself in the symphony of great games and good times.
This is the best arcade/pinball game bar in Charlotte hands down bar none.  Cheap drinks, good people, fun games.  What else do you need?
Small building and not enough parking.
Great atmosphere. Tons of awesome pinball. Cold beer. Perfect!
Hope they're able to reopen
I loved
this place is a blast. hoping they reopen after COVID because we always have so much fun here
I haven't been there I just wanted to know about it

Wasn't allowed in with my 13 year old niece. Guess the games are too violent or they are doing more than selling drinks and playing video games. We drove over an hour for the let down, went to The Basement Arcade Bar and was welcomed with open arms! I gave The Basement Arcade Bar 5 stars, and yes Abari, they are a members only bar too. Unless you're looking for trouble don't go to this place, you can tell by the door man that it's a druggie infested hangout, they were right, no place for a 13 year old, or a 37 year old man for that matter!
Live it here
Great arcade in a great town.
Great place to meet and play with groups.
Always been extremely hostile bartenders here, would like to see a change in that.
Great place! Bring your kids from 12 to 5 for free!
